Posts.EditableText:
Sounds like a good idea, but I have a couple of reservations:

1. "put together by the people of axeuk" - surely you mean the people of the axeuk forums? 'Cos I'm the only person of axeuk, see...

2. If you're going to copy and paste from my website, can you please at least acknowledge the source and that it's quoted?

And since it's a wiki, why not just make it public rather than password-protected? You can always revert any vandalism, just like most other wikis do.

Thanks
Alex
Posts.HTML:
Sounds like a good idea, but I have a couple of reservations:

1. "put together by the people of axeuk" - surely you mean the people of the axeuk forums? 'Cos I'm the only person of axeuk, see...

2. If you're going to copy and paste from my website, can you please at least acknowledge the source and that it's quoted?

And since it's a wiki, why not just make it public rather than password-protected? You can always revert any vandalism, just like most other wikis do.

Thanks

Posts.EditableText:
I see the "put together [b:1wnmmlt4]my[/b:1wnmmlt4] the people of axeuk" has been fixed, but the "Here you'll find loads of codes and methods" still grates. From a quick glance at the rest:

"No programming knowledge necessary, A full tutorial is included, reference guide included for Quest's more advanced functions, create single-player or multi-player games."

No capital A needed there, unless you're going to break it down into sentences. Which might be better actually. As it is, it's one horrible run-on sentence. Quite a few similar problems to this.

The biggest problem, though, is the lack of explanation for what most of the stuff does. Assuming I was new to IF, would I know what "watch variables" or "view timer information" or "inheritance of object properties" meant?
Posts.HTML:

"No programming knowledge necessary, A full tutorial is included, reference guide included for Quest's more advanced functions, create single-player or multi-player games."

No capital A needed there, unless you're going to break it down into sentences. Which might be better actually. As it is, it's one horrible run-on sentence. Quite a few similar problems to this.

The biggest problem, though, is the lack of explanation for what most of the stuff does. Assuming I was new to IF, would I know what "watch variables" or "view timer information" or "inheritance of object properties" meant?

Posts.EditableText:
Yeah. I'm not entering into the IFcomp. One because it's multiplayer, and I don't want to. I'm having fun with it. Yes, I've been working on it for over two years, but I've built a whole 'engine' on top of QuestNet to make it decent. I also don't plan to make my game last under two hours. I have put the game on hold many times, I know, but every time so far I have picked it back up when I have the free time to work on it. I tend to put my real life before this, as getting good qualifications and a job is important.

Btw, Davidw, where's your uber epic RPG?

[quote="Freak":ouk0h80m]For the status variable tutorial, I suggest adding
- the relevant windowshots
- the relevant ASL
or both.[/quote:ouk0h80m]

I don't think the ASL is necessary either, since after they follow my directions, they can open a text editor and view it themselves.  Thanks for the reply though.

or both.[/quote:1p5uxrul]

Very little that appears on a Wiki is "necessary". It's there for flavour and because people find it interesting. It's there to show people what a system is capable of and why they should be using it.

A decent manual for Quest isn't necessary, but if someone wrote one it might encourage people to use it.
